title: Android Weekly Issue #632
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Solve Mobile Bugs Faster Crashes, jank, and unresponsiveness in your Android app? Join us on Wednesday, July 31st to learn how to reproduce mobile issues and troubleshoot faster with a walkthrough of Session Replay for mobile. Architecture related decisions in Android - Mapping Zsolt Bertalan continues this series on Android app architecture, looking at mapping data between app layers. I DECLARE….DEPENDENCIESSSS!!! Kerry Bisset writes about injecting dependencies with Koin in runtime scenarios. Sponsored Should you set up a release manager rotation? Mobile releases don’t have to be shouldered by a single person or small group of SMEs using hidden know-how to make the whole thing run. With adequate preparation and support, any mobile engineer (or even a PM or QA) should be able to tackle a release with the right resources in hand. Learn how and why to set up a release rotation for your own team. Variance (in & out) in Kotlin Explained Michal Ankiersztajn takes a look at how in and out keywords work in Kotlin. Coroutine Cancellation and Timeouts Tanya Arora takes a look at how cancellation is a crucial feature of Kotlin coroutines for managing resources. Convert Your Native Project to Kotlin Multiplatform: Why, When and How This guide by Marcin Piekielny gives you all the information you need to move to Kotlin Multiplatform. Using Android Jetpack Datastore in Jetpack Compose Raheem Hameed writes about Jetpack Datastore, a new data storage solution in Android, and how to use it in a Compose application. How derivedStateOf works: a deep d(er)ive Zach Klippenstein explains derivedStateOf, focusing on code, including examples from the actual Compose source. Don't Lock the Screen Orientation! Handling Orientation in Compose Eevis Panula covers the topic of locked orientation. Place a sponsored post Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Libraries & Code Cloudy Jetpack Compose blur effect library, which falls back onto a CPU-based implementation to support older API levels. composables-core Unstyled, fully accessible Compose Multiplatform UI components that you can customize to your heart's desire. KMPNotifier Kotlin Multiplatform Push Notification Library targetting android, iOS, Desktop and Web (JS and Wasm) News The I/O journey continues in Bengaluru The next stop on Google's I/O Connect tour is Bengaluru, India. Prepare your app for the new Samsung Galaxy foldables and watches! Google shares how you can prepare your app for Wear OS 5 and how to build adaptive apps that scale across mobile, tablets, foldables and more! Videos & Podcasts DON'T HAVE These UseCases in your Android Code! Charfaoui Younes explores the incorrect use of the use case pattern in your Android app. Micro optimizations Tor and Romain find themselves without a guest and decide to chat about micro-optimizations and writing custom tools. ViewModel + Koin in a commonMain  -  Compose Multiplatform Learn more about ViewModel + Koin in KMP commonMain How to Generate Executables in KMP (apk, iab, msi, dmg, deb) Philipp Lackner shows you how to generate the relevant files to distribute your Kotlin Multiplatform app to Google Play, App Store, Windows, MacOS, and Linux. Image Carousel In Jetpack Compose Daniel Atitienei shows how to create an image carousel in Jetpack Compose. Introduction to Compose Tips for Delightful UI Intro to a new series of quick and easy Compose tips that'll make your UIs shine Edge-to-edge and insets This video will show you the three simple steps to safely handle insets to prevent content from overlapping system UI elements. droidcon San Francisco 2024 Videos of all the presentations from droidcon San Francisco 2024 Specials Campground Pull Request Before diving into a new feature, Kaushik Gopal asks the team to scout the parts of the codebase that will need to change. As we explore, refactor for clarity. Ktor vs. Spring Boot: 5 Key Differences for Kotlin Devs A thorough comparison of JetBrains' Ktor with Spring Boot.

Join us on Wednesday, July 31st to learn how to reproduce mobile issues and troubleshoot faster with a walkthrough of Session Replay for mobile. Mobile releases don’t have to be shouldered by a single person or small group of SMEs using hidden know-how to make the whole thing run. html:
Crashes, jank, and unresponsiveness in your Android app? Join us on Wednesday, July 31st to learn how to reproduce mobile issues and troubleshoot faster with a walkthrough of Session Replay for mobile.

Mobile releases don’t have to be shouldered by a single person or small group of SMEs using hidden know-how to make the whole thing run. With adequate preparation and support, any mobile engineer (or even a PM or QA) should be able to tackle a release with the right resources in hand. Learn how and why to set up a release rotation for your own team.

Jetpack Compose blur effect library, which falls back onto a CPU-based implementation to support older API levels.

Unstyled, fully accessible Compose Multiplatform UI components that you can customize to your heart's desire.

Kotlin Multiplatform Push Notification Library targetting android, iOS, Desktop and Web (JS and Wasm)

Tor and Romain find themselves without a guest and decide to chat about micro-optimizations and writing custom tools.

This video will show you the three simple steps to safely handle insets to prevent content from overlapping system UI elements.

Before diving into a new feature, Kaushik Gopal asks the team to scout the parts of the codebase that will need to change. As we explore, refactor for clarity.

]]>
